message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Why did you vote NO? Brief reason please">
ALL TEAM MEMBERS:

Follow-up: you all voted NO on "does this work need an introduction from others?" Please give your reason in 1-2 sentences. Why doesn't it need one?
</teammate-message>

input.content: The work's own method is phenomenological — it asks the reader to undergo experiences and then analyze them. An external introduction that pre-frames or pre-interprets those experiences would undermine the very mechanism by which the essays do their philosophical work. The author designed the reading order and experiential sequences precisely so that the text introduces itself through the reader's own engagement; adding someone else's interpretive lens before Essay 1 risks collapsing the productive openness the author constructed.
input.summary: Reason: external intro would undermine experiential method

routing.summary: Reason: external intro would undermine experiential method

content.text: Reason provided: an external introduction would pre-frame the reader's experience in ways that undermine the work's own phenomenological method, which depends on the reader encountering the experiential sequences with productive openness. Awaiting next task.
